adobe-illustrator.question: Q16. What is the purpose of the Make Pixel Perfect command?
options: to create responsive web graphics that can resize with no loss of quality
to ensure graphics use only web-safe colors
to have Illustrator automatically choose the right export file format based on the contents of the graphic
to create sharp web graphics with no anti-aliasing of straight lines
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: to create sharp web graphics with no anti-aliasing of straight lines

adobe-illustrator.question: Q17. You have just one object on your artboard. You want to change its fill color from black to yellow, so you open the Color Picker and select a yellow color. But when you click OK, the fill of the object changes to gray, not yellow. Why is this happening?
options: The color mode of the fill is set to Grayscale.
The Luminosity blend mode is applied to the fill.
One of the Color Blindness options is chosen under Proof Setup in the View menu.
Overprint Preview is turned on in the Separations Preview panel.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: The color mode of the fill is set to Grayscale.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q18. How can you ensure that proper nouns are not hyphenated in the document you're working on?
options: Turn off Hyphenate Capitalized Words in the Paragraph panel.
Select Justify All Lines in the Paragraph panel.
Decrease the Word Spacing in the justification options.
Increase the Hyphenation Zone value in the Paragraph panel so it is greater than the point size of the text.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Turn off Hyphenate Capitalized Words in the Paragraph panel.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q19. How could you quickly change all the hexagons to triangles in the image below?
options: In the Control panel, click the button to start editing similar shapes, then select Object > Path > Simplify.
In the Properties panel, click Start Global Edit and then use the Transform controls to reduce the Polygon Side Count to 3.
In the Properties panel, click Expand Shape. Then click Start Global Edit and use the Transform controls to reduce the Polygon Side Count to 3.
In the Control panel, click the button to start editing similar shapes, then select Object > Transform > Transform Each.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: In the Properties panel, click Start Global Edit and then use the Transform controls to reduce the Polygon Side Count to 3.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q20. You're working with a pen tablet and find that using the Ellipse, Rectangle, and Polygon tools to create objects is somewhat awkward. Which tool would allow you to draw, move, and edit these shapes with intuitive gestures?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: the Shaper tool

adobe-illustrator.question: Q21. When using the Live Paint Bucket tool to fill artwork with colors, you are unable to fill some areas due to the size of gaps between paths. What can you do in the Gap Options dialog box to fix this problem?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Select Large Gaps.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q22. You often use brushes from the Pattern Arrows brush library. How can you make it so this library automatically opens when you start Illustrator?
options: Select Show Pattern Brushes from the Brushes panel menu.
Select Persistent from the library's panel menu.
Open the library and save a custom workspace.
Select all the brushes in the Pattern Arrows brush library and choose Add to Brushes from the library's panel menu.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Select Persistent from the library's panel menu.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q23. In the image below, you are attempting to use the Join tool to remove the overlapping portions of two paths (highlighted in yellow), but nothing seems to be happening. Why is this?
options: The paths do not have a fill attribute.
Only one of the paths is selected, but both need to be selected.
One of the paths is selected but the Join tool works only with unselected paths.
Endpoints need to be selected in both paths before they can be trimmed and joined.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: The paths do not have a fill attribute.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q24. Which colorization method should you choose when using an art, scatter, or pattern brush to apply a spot color?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Tints

adobe-illustrator.question: Q25. You have drawn a five-pointed star in a design and want to change the inner radius. How would you achieve this?
options: An Inner Radius of a Star cannot be modified and would have to be redrawn.
Use the Scale tool while holding down Option+Shift (Mac) or Alt+Shift (Windows).
Select the inner points, then use the Scale tool to uniformly change the radius.
Double-click the Star tool and change the Inner Radius option.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Select the inner points, then use the Scale tool to uniformly change the radius.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q26. What is the meaning of the three dots on the cloud icon in the image below?
options: The Alana fonts are for web-only use.
The Alana fonts are currently being activated.
Not all the fonts in the Alana family are activated.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: The Alana fonts are currently being activated.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q27. What command would you apply to make objects beneath the selected artwork visible inside the circle?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Make Compound Path

adobe-illustrator.question: Q28. The Symbol Sprayer tool has been used to apply several symbol instances to an illustration. You would like to modify the appearance of some instances using graphic styles. How would this be achieved?
options: Select instances with the Group Selection tool and then choose the desired graphic style.
Symbol instances in a symbol set cannot be overridden.
Select instances with the Direct Selection tool and then choose the desired graphic style.
With the Symbol Styler tool, select a graphic style and paint the style onto symbol instances.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: With the Symbol Styler tool, select a graphic style and paint the style onto symbol instances.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q29. What happens when you click an existing anchor point with the Pen tool?
options: Any control handles are removed, converting the point into a corner point.
The path is split at that point.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: The point is deleted.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q30. When creating a mesh object, when should you use the Mesh tool instead of the Create Gradient Mesh command in the Object menu?
options: when you want to create simpler meshes so the performance of Illustrator is not negatively affected
when you want to place a highlight at the edge of the object
when you want to create mesh lines at equally spaced intervals within the object
when you want to create mesh lines at one or more specific locations within the object
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: when you want to create mesh lines at one or more specific locations within the object

adobe-illustrator.question: Q31. When viewing the artwork shown below in Outline mode, what can you tell about the word "backpack"?
options: It has been converted to outlines.
It has a fill color of black.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: It is live text.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q32. You would like the columns in a chart to cover the whole length of the category axis. What option would you choose?
options: In the Graph Type dialog, choose Category Axis and set the Tick Marks option to Full Width.
In the Graph Type dialog, under Graph Options, set the cluster width to 100 in the Options section.
In the first row of data, type 100% in each cell corresponding to the category columns.
Select the columns with the Direct Selection tool and use the Scale tool to modify the width.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: In the Graph Type dialog, choose Category Axis and set the Tick Marks option to Full Width.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q33. If you are looking for a tool in the toolbar and it is not visible, what should you do?
options: With nothing selected, click the More Tools button in the Properties panel.
Click the ellipsis at the bottom of the toolbar.
Turn on the tool in the preferences.
In the Window menu, click Window > Tools.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: In the Window menu, click Window > Tools.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q34. The four flowers shown in the image below were created by applying an art brush to paths of different lengths. How can you prevent the distortion seen in flowers 2, 3, and 4 while keeping the size of the leaves and the width of the stem the same in all the flowers?
options: Open the Art Brush Options dialog box and select Scale Proportionally.
Expand the appearance of the distorted flowers and drag the flowers with the Selection tool.
Use the Pen tool to add points at the top and bottom of the stem, and then drag the points with the Direct Selection tool to remove the distortion.
Open the Art Brush Options dialog box, select Stretch Between Guides, and then place the guides so only the stem is between them.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Expand the appearance of the distorted flowers and drag the flowers with the Selection tool.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q35. When printing an image with many out-of-gamut colors, which rendering intent would you choose to best preserve the visual relationship between colors—not the specific color values?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Perceptual

adobe-illustrator.question: Q36. Why would you change the Expand Mesh value when using the Puppet Warp tool?
options: It allows you to work faster because modifying a larger mesh requires fewer calculations.
It allows you to modify disjointed objects together
It allows you to make greater modifications to an object.
It allows you to see the mesh more clearly.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: It allows you to make greater modifications to an object.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q37. When using the Image Trace feature, which option has the most impact on the number of paths that are created in the tracing result?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Corners

adobe-illustrator.question: Q38. If you want to create an image map, which panel would you use to make an object into a clickable region?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: SVG Interactivity

adobe-illustrator.question: Q39. Why use the Simplify command before exporting a web graphic to SVG format?
options: to reduce the number of points that must be represented in the code
to remove invisible points and lines
to reduce the output resolution so it's appropriate for web graphics
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: to remove invisible points and lines

adobe-illustrator.question: Q40. You have designed the product label shown below. Your client wants the black circle to print as dark as possible and requires that none of the colorful logo elements show through the circle when the label is printed. What should you do?
options: Select the circle and turn on Overprint Fill in the Attributes panel.
Select the circle and apply the Multiply blending mode.
Fill the circle with a rich black color made up of all four process inks.
Use the Appearance panel to add a second black fill.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Select the circle and turn on Overprint Fill in the Attributes panel.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q41. You are working with an Illustrator file that includes a linked Photoshop file. Your client sends a new Photoshop file with a different name and asks you to replace the old one in the Illustrator file. Which command in the Links panel would you use to accomplish this?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Relink

adobe-illustrator.question: Q42. The fill colors of several instances of a dynamic symbol have been modified. What is the fastest way to return the fill color in every instance to its original appearance?
options: set the Export Type to Movie Clip
delete the symbol and expand all instances
convert the symbol to a static symbol
break the link to the symbol
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: convert the symbol to a static symbol

adobe-illustrator.question: Q43. In the gift card shown below, the magenta flower petals need to be printed with a varnish. How would you set up the file so the varnish is applied over the magenta color of the petals?
options: Use File Info to leave instructions for your print service provider.
Duplicate the petals to a new layer called "Varnish."
Make sure that the magenta color is from a spot color swatch.
Create copies of the petals on top of the original artwork and fill the petals with a new spot color swatch set to overprint.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Create copies of the petals on top of the original artwork and fill the petals with a new spot color swatch set to overprint.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q44. Your client likes the pattern fill in the text below but wants the flowers to overlap more so there are smaller gaps. How could you accomplish that?
options: Select Size Tile to Art in the Pattern Options dialog box.
Increase the number of copies of the flower used to make the pattern.
Reduce the width and height in the Pattern Options dialog box.
Use the Overlap buttons in the Pattern Options dialog box.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Reduce the width and height in the Pattern Options dialog box.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q45. Why would you turn on the Ignore Artboards option in the Print dialog box?
options: to prevent Illustrator from printing marks showing the borders of the artboard
to print all artboards on one piece of paper
to prevent Illustrator from printing the names of artboards
to scale each artboard to the media size
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: to print all artboards on one piece of paper

adobe-illustrator.question: Q46. You need to process a large batch of Illustrator files, applying the same sequence of transformations to each one. What is the most efficient way to do this?
options: Use the Actions panel to record and play back the sequence of steps.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Use the Actions panel to record and play back the sequence of steps.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q47. Why would you choose Enable Guides for 9-slice scaling when creating a symbol?
options: to allow portions of the symbol to be exported as separate graphics
to ensure that each instance of the symbol always maintains its original proportions when scaled
to include custom guides with the symbol so each instance is placed in the same position relative to the artboard
to allow instances of the symbol to be scaled without distorting the corners
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: to allow instances of the symbol to be scaled without distorting the corners

adobe-illustrator.question: Q48. What can you do to edit the text in just one placed instance of a symbol?
options: Click the Edit Symbol button in the Control panel or Properties panel.
Double-click the instance with the Type tool.
Click the Break Link button in the Control panel or Properties panel.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Click the Break Link button in the Control panel or Properties panel.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q49. Your colleague has asked you to provide the CSS code for an object in your document. What must you do to make Illustrator auto-generate the code for that particular object?
options: Drag the object into the Asset Export panel.
Select the object and choose Generate CSS from the CSS Properties panel.
Select the object and choose Copy Selected Style from the CSS Properties panel.
Give the object a name in the Layers panel.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Give the object a name in the Layers panel.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q50. You have drawn objects on planes using the perspective grid, but now want to change the angles of the grid to new vanishing points and have the artwork update automatically. What option should be enabled to achieve this result?
options: Enable Viewing Angle in the Define Grid dialog box.
Choose View > Perspective Grid > Lock Station Point
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Enable Perspective Warp.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q51. What happens when you assign a different color profile to an image?
options: The onscreen appearance stays the same, but the color values in the image will change.
The onscreen appearance may change, but the color values in the image stay the same.
Neither the onscreen appearance nor the color values in the image will change. Only the metadata in File Info changes.
Both the onscreen appearance and the color values in the image will change
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: The onscreen appearance stays the same, but the color values in the image will change.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q52. Which image adjustment is not available as an adjustment layer?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Shadows/Highlights

adobe-illustrator.question: Q53. The illustrator tool which is shown as a white arrow is known as the `___`
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Direct Selection Tool

adobe-illustrator.question: Q54. Which of the following correctly defines the method by which Adobe Illustrator creates images?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Vector

adobe-illustrator.question: Q55. Adobe Illustrator terminology for drawn lines is `___`
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Path

adobe-illustrator.question: Q56. Which of the following does the Paragraph menu not operate?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Leading

adobe-illustrator.question: Q57. Which of the following tools will cut a path into two different paths?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: scissors tool

adobe-illustrator.question: Q58. The two overlapping boxes at the bottom of the Adobe Illustrator toolbox control `___`
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: fill and stroke

adobe-illustrator.question: Q59. A curve created in Adobe Illustrator is commonly referred to as `___`
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Bezier Curve

adobe-illustrator.question: Q60. Which of the following is not a benefit of using layers?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: artwork outlines are easily seen

adobe-illustrator.question: Q61. The Pathfinder tool
options: finds a path for stroke size
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: combines grouped objects

adobe-illustrator.question: Q62. Selected tools from the toolbox will remain selected
options: Until the software is shut down
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Until another tool is selected

adobe-illustrator.question: Q63. In Adobe Illustrator we create our design and Illustrator on `___`
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Artboard

adobe-illustrator.question: Q64. How many types of page orientation are in Adobe Illustrator?
Q65. The shortcut of the Selection tool in Adobe Illustrator is `___`
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: V

adobe-illustrator.question: Q66. Why does the top point of this star appear different from the other points?
options: The stroke has a corner type of Bevel Join.
The star is an open path with two overlapping points at the top.
The Limit value in the Stroke panel is less than the stroke width.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: The star is an open path with two overlapping points at the top.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q67. When creating a new color swatch, how can you ensure that the appearance of objects colored with that swatch will update if you edit the swatch at a later time?
options: Give the swatch a custom name.
Click **Global** in the **Swatch Options** dialog box.
Place the swatch in a color group.
Add the swatch to a Creative Cloud library.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Click **Global** in the **Swatch Options** dialog box.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q68. Which statement is true about working in Isolation mode?
options: You can print and export individual objects by isolating them first.
All non-isolated objects cannot be selected or edited.
You cannot isolate more than one object at a time.
You can Shift-click non-isolated objects to make them editable.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: All non-isolated objects cannot be selected or edited.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q69. When saving a file in Adobe Illustrator (AI) format, which setting is essential to ensure that someone using Acrobat Reader can open and view the file?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Include Linked Files

adobe-illustrator.question: Q70. Drop shadows in a printed document appear pixelated. Which feature can you use to fix this?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Document Raster Effects Settings

adobe-illustrator.question: Q71. Where can you find information about an image's author and copyright status?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: the **File Info** dialog box

adobe-illustrator.question: Q72. What can happen if you don't add bleed to a print document?
options: Black strokes may appear thinner than expected.
Blank areas may be visible at the edges of the print.
Areas of 100% black may print lighter than expected.
Blank areas may be visible where two inks are printed adjacent to each other.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Blank areas may be visible at the edges of the print.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q73. How can you ensure that objects on a specific layer remain visible on screen in Illustrator but never appear when the file is printed?
options: Make a clipping mask with the layer selected.
Drag the layer to the bottom of the **Layers** panel.
Turn off the **Print** option for the layer.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Turn off the **Print** option for the layer.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q74. If you had to send a file to a colleague, how could you collect everything needed to work on it, including any non-Adobe fonts and linked images?
options: Select **Select All** and then click the **Add Content** button in the **Libraries** panel.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Use the **Package** command.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q75. When working with a two-point perspective grid, which is set in the **Define Perspective Grid** dialog box do you use to change the size of grid cells so you can draw and move objects with more precision?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Gridling every

adobe-illustrator.question: Q76. Which option do you use to create the stroke shown below?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Round Cap

adobe-illustrator.question: Q77. Where can you add arrowheads to a line or arc?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: The Stroke panel.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q78. By default, what happens when you create two overlapping brush strokes of the same color with the Blob Brush tool?
options: The brush strokes are merged into one object.
The two strokes become a compound shape.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: The brush strokes are merged into one object.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q79. Which transform setting allows you to scale an object and its drop shadow at the same time?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Scale Strokes & Effects

adobe-illustrator.question: Q80. To create a pattern brush with custom corners and/or custom endpoints, what must you create first?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: a pattern swatch

adobe-illustrator.question: Q81. Which Paintbrush tool setting should you adjust if you want to create paths with fewer anchor points?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Fidelity

adobe-illustrator.question: Q82. This image shows a variable data project file for a business card. Which properties of the Color_Blocks variable are dynamic?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: visibility

adobe-illustrator.question: Q83. If you group objects that are on different layers, all of the objects will `___`.
options: be placed in a new sublayer of the topmost layer of the elected objects
be placed in a newly created layer above the other layers
be placed on the topmost layer of the selected objects
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: be placed on the topmost layer of the selected objects

adobe-illustrator.question: Q84. Using the Width tool, how could you make the stroke on the top path match the bottom one?
options: Press and hold the Option (Mac) or Alt (Windows) key, and drag the selected width point to the left.
Drag the selected width point left until it snaps to the same position as the adjacent width point.
Double-click the selected width point and set the **Total Width** value to **0**.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Drag the selected width point left until it snaps to the same position as the adjacent width point.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q85. Why should you use the Simplify command before exporting a web graphic to SVG format?
options: to reduce the number of points that must be represented in the code
to remove invisible points and lines
to reduce the output resolution so it's appropriate for web graphics
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: to reduce the number of points that must be represented in the code

adobe-illustrator.question: Q86. Using the Width tool, how do you change just one side of the stroke width?
options: Select a width point, press and hold the Option (Mac) or Alt (Windows) key, and drag on it.
Select a width point and use the **Properties** panel to adjust the size of each side independently.
You cannot change just one side of the stroke width.
Select a width point, press and hold the Shift key, and drag on it.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Select a width point, press and hold the Option (Mac) or Alt (Windows) key, and drag on it.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q87. How can you change the pattern fill in this image so that the flowers overlap more with smaller gaps?
options: Use the **Overlap** buttons in the **Pattern Options** dialog box.
Select **Size Tile to Art** in the **Pattern Options** dialog box.
Reduce the width and height in the **Pattern Options** dialog box.
Increase the number of copies of the flower used to make the pattern.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Reduce the width and height in the **Pattern Options** dialog box.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q88. Using `___` can reduce file size and maintain consistency.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: symbols

adobe-illustrator.question: Q89. You have access to the Creative Cloud library shown below, which was shared via the Collaborate feature library. For a particular document, you need to use the 10% Discount graphic but change the fill color to green. You're not allowed to change how this graphic appears for anyone else with access to the library. What must you do to accomplish this?
options: Right-click the graphic in the library and select **Place Linked**.
Drag the graphic into your document and use the **Properties** panel to change the fill.
Drag the graphic into your document and click the **Edit Original** button in the **Control** panel.
Drag the graphic into your document while holding the Option (Mac) or Alt (Windows) key.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Drag the graphic into your document while holding the Option (Mac) or Alt (Windows) key.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q90. Which statement is true when you crop a linked image?
options: You can adjust or remove the crop later on to show the entire linked image.
A cropped copy of the image file is saved at the same location as the current document and is linked to the Illustrator file.
A warning appears telling you that pixels from the original image file will be permanently removed.
A cropped copy of the image file is saved on disk and linked to the Illustrator file.
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: A cropped copy of the image file is saved at the same location as the current document and is linked to the Illustrator file.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q91. What would you do to make the objects beneath the selected artwork visible inside the circle?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Make a compound path.

adobe-illustrator.question: Q92. what does the outline color of a selected path or bounding box indicate?
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: the current stroke color

adobe-illustrator.question: Q93. Fundamental transformation tools include all of the following except:
adobe-illustrator.correctAnswer: Invert

adobe-in-design.question: Q1. What is one reason to click Object > Text Frame Options?
options: to change the number of columns in a text frame
to apply a drop shadow to the frame
to change the corners of a frame from corner to rounded
to change the fill and stroke of a text frame
adobe-in-design.correctAnswer: to change the number of columns in a text frame

adobe-in-design.question: Q2. Which panel allows you to add an arrowhead to the end of a line?
Q3. In the image shown, what do you know about the Body Text paragraph style?
options: The selected text was not formatted using the style definition.
The selected text is in overset text outside the boundaries of the current frame.
The style has been applied to two or more paragraphs.
The style has been added since the master styles were created.
adobe-in-design.correctAnswer: The selected text was not formatted using the style definition.

adobe-in-design.question: Q4. You want to ensure that an image on your page is exactly 25% of its original size. How can you determine whether the image is set to the desired size?
options: Double-click the image with the Selection tool.
Select the graphic frame with the Selection tool.
adobe-in-design.correctAnswer: Double-click the image with the Selection tool.

adobe-in-design.question: Q5. You have an empty one-page InDesign document. You have used File > Place to select a Word document that contains many pages of text. What will help you place the full story quickly?
options: Select **Show Import Options** in the **Place** dialog box.
Right-click the page with the place cursor.
Shift-click with the place cursor inside the margin guides.
In the **Pages** panel, click the **New Pages** button with the place cursor.
adobe-in-design.correctAnswer: Shift-click with the place cursor inside the margin guides.

adobe-in-design.question: Q6. You select a graphic frame that contains a Photoshop image and use the Scale field in the Control panel to enlarge it to 200%. What happens to the effective image resolution?
options: Effective image resolution stays the same until you choose from the View > Display Performance menu.
Effective image resolution is set in Photoshop, not in InDesign, so it stays the same.
The resolution is cut in half.
adobe-in-design.correctAnswer: The resolution is cut in half.

adobe-in-design.question: Q7. What is one reason you might want to use the Text Variables feature?
options: to create captions underneath images that update automatically
to include calculations inside a dynamic table
to adjust text size automatically to fill the frame
to create running headers that include chapter names
adobe-in-design.correctAnswer: to create running headers that include chapter names

adobe-in-design.question: Q8. You want to place 4 of a multipage PDF into an InDesign document. What should you do?
options: In the **Place** dialog box, select **Show Import Options**.
Import the PDF with the **Media** panel instead of **File>Place**
Open the PDF in Acrobat, select page 4, and drag it into InDesign.
After placing the PDF, disable the unwanted pages in the Media panel.
adobe-in-design.correctAnswer: In the **Place** dialog box, select **Show Import Options**.

adobe-in-design.question: Q9. Suppose that master page B is based on master page A, and you are currently editing master B. Which statement is true?
options: Objects on master page A are not visible.
Objects on master page A must always appear behind objects from master page B.
Objects on master page A cannot be selected unless you override the objects.
Objects on master page A cannot be selected or changed.
adobe-in-design.correctAnswer: Objects on master page A cannot be selected unless you override the objects.

adobe-in-design.question: Q10. In the image shown, the text is on a path. You want to move the text farther to the right along the path. How can you accomplish this?
options: Drag the center tick mark C.

adobe-in-design.question: Q11. When you select a rectangular frame on the page, InDesign displays a yellow square near the frame's upper-right corner. What does this allow you to do?
options: Change the corners from square to round.
Anchor the object into another frame.
Change the layer or z-order of the frame.
Link the frame to another frame.
adobe-in-design.correctAnswer: Change the corners from square to round.

adobe-in-design.question: Q12. What action can the Pen tool perform on a selected object?
options: The Pen tool cannot affect an object after it has been created.
You can click a point to convert it to a curve.
You can drag the Pen tool inside a frame to convert it to a compound shape.
You can click a point to delete it.

Select the items and click Composition > New Composition.
after-effects.correctAnswer: Select the items and click Composition > New Composition from Selection.

after-effects.question: Q23. You attach a video monitor to view your color correction. Where can you configure the monitor’s preferences?
Q24. A file is in the Render Queue but cannot be rendered. You see that it is labeled Needs Output. What should you do?
options: Set an output file name from the Render To menu.
Set an output file name and location from the Output To menu.
after-effects.correctAnswer: Set an output file name and location from the Output To menu.

after-effects.question: Q25. Which effect cannot be applied to a mask shape?
Q26. What type of object creates a single-color layer for use as a backdrop?
Q27. What is the maximum number of masks that can be applied to a single layer in an After Effects 7.0 composition?
Q28. What is Adobe After Effects primarily used for?
Q29. Which panel in After Effects allows you to organize and control your project assets?
Q30. In After Effects, what does the "Keyframe" function allow you to do?
Q31. Which file format is commonly used for importing and exporting video in After Effects?
Q32. What is the purpose of the "Puppet Pin Tool" in After Effects?
Q33. What is the workspace layout called where you can preview your composition in After Effects?
Q34. Which of the following effects in After Effects allows you to simulate the appearance of real-world camera depth of field?
Q35. What does the "Wiggle Expression" do in After Effects?
options: Adds random motion to a layer
Applies a color effect to text
after-effects.correctAnswer: Adds random motion to a layer

after-effects.question: Q36. In After Effects, what does the "Track Matte" feature do?
options: Creates transitions between two video clips
after-effects.correctAnswer: Creates transitions between two video clips

after-effects.question: Q37. Which of the following is a keyframe interpolation method in After Effects that creates smooth, flowing animations between keyframes?
Q38. Which shortcut key provides quick access to the Opacity controls for a selected layer?
Q39. What happens when you change the zero point (origin) for the rulers in the Composition viewer (panel)?
options: After effects begins calculating according to new origin of the composition only for 3D layers.
After effects begins calculating from the middle of the composition.
After effects begins calculating according to the new origin of the composition.
After effects continues to calculate from the top-left origin of the composition.
after-effects.correctAnswer: After effects begins calculating according to the new origin of the composition.

after-effects.question: Q40. Changes made to rotation or position in 3D space are attached to the layer and not based on the composition. Which axis mode would you want to use to have changes based on the axes in the Composition panel?
Q41. Which characteristics do the Render settings control?
Q42. Which Keyframe Assistant is shown here?
Q43. Which path operation creates multiple copies of a single shape?
Q44. Write characteristics do the output module settings control?
options: Animate layers by manually drawing their motion paths

agile-methodologies.question: Q1. Teams may encounter the need for "technical" user stories. Who decides the priority of these?
options: the Product Owner with help from Operations
the Tech Lead with help from the Product Owner
the Product Owner with help from the Tech Lead
the Tech Lead with help from Operations
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: the Product Owner with help from the Tech Lead

agile-methodologies.question: Q2. What is the Scrum Master's role during the daily stand-up?
options: Congratulate the team on their great work.
Stand outside the circle of developers and listen for impediments.
The Scrum Master should not attend—this meeting is for developers only.
Ask each developer what they have done since the last daily standup.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Stand outside the circle of developers and listen for impediments.

agile-methodologies.question: Q3. Which factor should not be considered during Sprint Planning?
options: the number of stories in the product backlog
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: the number of stories in the product backlog

agile-methodologies.question: Q4. A team member has been showing signs of great personal distress: crying at work, snapping at colleagues, and having heated phone conversations. As a Team Facilitator, what should you do?
options: Report this at the Sprint Release.
Advise the PO as soon as possible. (Old answer: Notify the team member's manager of your observations and ask the manager for help.)
Point out the reasons why and collaborate on solutions.
Ask the PO to extend the sprint.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Advise the PO as soon as possible. (Old answer: Notify the team member's manager of your observations and ask the manager for help.)

agile-methodologies.question: Q5. Which statement describes the flow of work in the Scaled Agile Framework?
options: It is "push" at the top and "pull" at the bottom.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: It is neither "push" nor "pull."

agile-methodologies.question: Q6. What is the Product Owner's role in deciding the priority of work in the sprint backlog?
options: None—the Scrum Master should prioritize the work in the sprint backlog.
The PO should prioritize the items in the sprint backlog.
The developers prioritize work unless they cannot complete it, in which case the PO should prioritize the remaining work.
None—the developers should prioritize the work in the sprint backlog.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: None—the developers should prioritize the work in the sprint backlog.

agile-methodologies.question: Q7. The Scaled Agile Framework advocates that, if you measure only one thing, what should you measure?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: cost of delay

agile-methodologies.question: Q8. Why should you apply for the Weighted Shortest Job First?
options: to maximize the return on investment
to determine the economic sequencing of the backlog
to fulfill a commitment to quality
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: to determine the economic sequencing of the backlog

agile-methodologies.question: Q9. You have classified the features in your backlog according to risk and value. Which features should the development team work on first?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: high-value and high-risk

agile-methodologies.question: Q10. In the Scaled Agile Framework, what is the role of Enablers?
options: They help extend the Architectural Runway.
They connect vision to mission so the organization can be successful.
They remove the impediments to quality.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: They help extend the Architectural Runway.

agile-methodologies.question: Q11. Which outcome is not expected of a Sprint Review?
options: The team demonstrates its completed work.
The team reflects on how to improve its performance.
Items in the backlog may be reprioritized.
Stakeholders ask questions about the completed and upcoming backlog items.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: The team reflects on how to improve its performance.

agile-methodologies.question: Q12. What is not a technique used for splitting user stories?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: split compound user stories

agile-methodologies.question: Q13. Who decides what the team will work on?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: a self-organizing team

agile-methodologies.question: Q14. Which choice is not a Scrum value?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: integrity

agile-methodologies.question: Q15. What should happen if the Product Owner does not accept a story by the end of the iteration?
options: The team does not get credit for the story's points in its velocity calculation.
The story should be sliced to reflect the work completed.
The acceptance criteria should be adjusted to reflect the work completed.
The story should be shown to stakeholders for their feedback.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: The story should be shown to stakeholders for their feedback.

agile-methodologies.question: Q16. Which statement is not true about the product backlog?
options: It is a list of work items that are behind schedule.
The items are maintained in priority order.
Anyone on the team can propose an item for it.
It includes all of the work to be done.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: It is a list of work items that are behind schedule.

agile-methodologies.question: Q17. A project has some major risks that the team wants to mitigate. What is the best way to monitor how well this effort is going?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: risk burndown graph

agile-methodologies.question: Q18. The VP of Engineering wants to start giving out a "Team Member of the Sprint" award to recognize a top performer in each group. What advice should you give this VP?
options: This is unhelpful unless there has been recent employee feedback indicating that people feel underappreciated.
This is a good idea as long as a different person is recognized in each sprint.
This is a good idea because awards can motivate people to do their best.
This is unhelpful because it can destroy the team unity essential to achieving high performance.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: This is unhelpful because it can destroy the team unity essential to achieving high performance.

agile-methodologies.question: Q19. What is the difference between a team's task board and a Kanban?
options: A Kanban has an explicit rule to limit WIP.
A Kanban shows the backlog of work.
A Kanban does not use a Definition of Done.
A Kanban shows the status of the work items.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: A Kanban has an explicit rule to limit WIP.

agile-methodologies.question: Q20. The team complains that "things have been falling through the cracks lately." What should you do?
options: Ask the team's manager to make role assignments so the team can catch up.
Conduct a workshop to identify all of the things that need to be done and see who can help with each.
Refer to the team's RACI (Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, Informed) assignments.
Meet with the Tech Lead and Product Owner to try to identify what can be done.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Conduct a workshop to identify all of the things that need to be done and see who can help with each.

agile-methodologies.question: Q21. In Large-Scale Scrum, what is the recommended ratio of Scrum Masters to teams?
options: One Scrum Master can support up to five teams.
Large teams should have two Scrum Masters.
There should be one Scrum Master per team.
One Scrum Master can support one to three teams.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: One Scrum Master can support one to three teams.

agile-methodologies.question: Q22. In the Cynefin framework, where are "best practices" most appropriate?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: In the Obvious regime

agile-methodologies.question: Q23. A manager informs you that a developer from another team is between assignments, and she wants to place the developer on your team for a few sprints. What should you do?
options: Explain to the manager that this will be disruptive to the team and ask that another assignment be found.
Explain the situation to the team and ask them to go with the flow.
Explain the situation to your manager and ask them to resolve it.
When the temporary developer shows up, assign them to write documentation.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Explain to the manager that this will be disruptive to the team and ask that another assignment be found.

agile-methodologies.question: Q24. The Product Owner complains to you that the team is not working hard enough and they need to increase their velocity by at least 50%. Which action should you not take?
options: Share the feedback from the PO and challenge the team to increase their velocity.
Ask the PO to explain the business context to the team.
Explain the impact of technical debt on the PO and the benefits of devoting some capacity to reducing it.
Hold a Value Stream Mapping workshop to identify and reduce waste.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Share the feedback from the PO and challenge the team to increase their velocity.

agile-methodologies.question: Q25. What is the name of the practice in which a cross-functional team collaborates intensively to develop a new product idea?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Hackathon

agile-methodologies.question: Q26. The team's manager wants to attend the Sprint Retrospective. What should you do?
options: Agree to the manager's request and notify the team.
Propose that the manager attend only every other retrospective.
Propose a different forum for the manager to meet with the team.
Ask the team if it is okay with them that the manager attend.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Propose a different forum for the manager to meet with the team.

agile-methodologies.question: Q27. Who is responsible for a Scrum team's performance?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: the Scrum Master

agile-methodologies.question: Q28. Which statement concerning small, frequent releases of software is true?
options: The chance for rollback is high.
It typically requires a high degree of automation.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: It typically requires a high degree of automation.

agile-methodologies.question: Q29. What is the activity of clarifying and expanding user stories called?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: backlog refinement

agile-methodologies.question: Q30. Which strategy is preferred for development teams?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Maximize outcome while minimizing output.

agile-methodologies.question: Q31. Which statement is true about the actor in a user story?
options: The actor does not have to have a specified role in the solution.
There must be multiple personas for each actor.
The actor can be the system itself.
The system cannot be the actor.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: The actor can be the system itself.

agile-methodologies.question: Q32. Which statement is true about Agile?
options: Agile requires a high degree of up-front planning.
Once the requirements are agreed to, the team can complete the work.
Agile requires a high degree of discipline.
Agile works best when there is no contract.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Agile requires a high degree of discipline.

agile-methodologies.question: Q33. Which statement about burndown and burnup charts is not true?
options: Burndown charts show the work remaining to be done.
Burnup charts show the work completed.
Burndown charts are more useful than burnup charts.
Agile project management tools can produce these automatically.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Burndown charts are more useful than burnup charts.

agile-methodologies.question: Q34. What is the name for the practice of going to see a process in use at the point of value delivery?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Gemba Walk

agile-methodologies.question: Q35. When the team needs to make a decision, what is the best course of action?
options: Take a vote and the majority rules.
Identify the most knowledgeable person and ask them to decide.
Let the most senior member of the team decide.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Try to achieve consensus.

agile-methodologies.question: Q36. Which action is something the Team facilitator should NOT do?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Estimate story points.

agile-methodologies.question: Q37. A team needs to do research, design, or prototyping. What is this type of story called?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Exploratory spike

agile-methodologies.question: Q38. Which statement about technical debt is true?
options: Technical debt is another name for bugs
It is at the Product Owner's discretion to allocate effort to reduce technical debt.
Adding technical debt should be avoided at all costs.
Technical debt is what the Product Owner owes to the developers if they work a lot of overtime to complete the sprint.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Adding technical debt should be avoided at all costs.

agile-methodologies.question: Q39. Which statement about estimating is not true?
options: Absolute estimating is more reliable than relative estimating.
Relative estimating is more reliable than absolute estimating.
In estimating, accuracy is more important than precision.
In estimating, the effort is more important than the time required.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Absolute estimating is more reliable than relative estimating.

agile-methodologies.question: Q40. Which ceremony should the Product Owner not attend?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: code reviews

agile-methodologies.question: Q41. Which task is not the product owner's responsibility?
options: giving feedback to developers about the user stories
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: giving feedback to developers about the user stories

agile-methodologies.question: Q42. Which choice is `_not_` considered during Sprint Planning?
options: stories that meet the Definition of Done
stories that meet the Definition of Ready
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: stories that meet the Definition of Done

agile-methodologies.question: Q43. You have noticed a pattern that the most interesting stories on the Sprint Backlog get started right away, and the least interesting stories languish or don't get done. What should you do?
options: Use a lottery system to assign each story.
Share your observation with the team and invite them to own and solve the problem.
During story point estimation increase the points assigned to the least interesting stories so the team can boost their velocity.
Ask the Tech Lead to assign every story to a developer so they all get done efficiently and with accountability.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Ask the Tech Lead to assign every story to a developer so they all get done efficiently and with accountability.

agile-methodologies.question: Q44. What Agile practice best supports this principle: "At regular intervals, the team reflects on how to become more effective, then tunes and adjusts its behavior accordingly"?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Sprint Retrospective

agile-methodologies.question: Q45. On what are personas typically based?
options: a sponsor or team members' personalities and traits
what the developers think is user friendly
real people, archetypal users, or composites of multiple users
descriptions of the product's functionality and use
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: real people, archetypal users, or composites of multiple users

agile-methodologies.question: Q46. Which statement describes Shu Ha Ri?
options: It is a library of coding patterns.
It is a software testing strategy.
It is a standard for interface design.
It is a model for skill development and mastery.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: It is a model for skill development and mastery.

agile-methodologies.question: Q47. What does the Agile Manifesto indicate?
options: Responding to change is more valuable than following a plan.
Documenting requirements up front is more valuable than at the end.
Following the plan is essential for not going over budget.
Contract negotiation should be used to settle disputes.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Responding to change is more valuable than following a plan.

agile-methodologies.question: Q48. What is the main benefit of a working agreement?
options: It clarifies the reporting relationships on the team.
It defines the culture that the team aspires to achieve.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: It defines the culture that the team aspires to achieve.

agile-methodologies.question: Q49. What is the name of the information radiator that has multiple columns used to visualize the flow of work?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Kanban Board

agile-methodologies.question: Q50. Which is the best definition of story points?
options: They are a relative measure of the effort needed to complete a story.
They are a measure of development time only, test time is considered separately.
They are a relative measure of the value of a story.
They are a measure of time to complete a story.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: They are a relative measure of the effort needed to complete a story.

agile-methodologies.question: Q51. What is a Scrum of Scrums?
options: It is a technique for two or more teams working together to coordinate their efforts.
It is another name for the Scrum Master Community of Practice.
It is an information radiator used to compare the velocity of several teams.
It is the system demo for teams on the same release train.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: It is a technique for two or more teams working together to coordinate their efforts.

agile-methodologies.question: Q52. What is the Product Owner's role regarding the product backlog?
options: The PO must identify the intended users of the features on the backlog.
The PO is responsible for estimating the size of the total.
The PO must identify the dependencies that impact the backlog.
The PO decides what to include in the backlog and what to exclude.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: The PO must identify the dependencies that impact the backlog.

agile-methodologies.question: Q53. Why should a team do refactoring?
options: It assigns developers to other teams to eliminate personality conflicts.
It improves the functionality of the product,
It recalibrates the success criteria for the product in the marketplace.
It improves the design, which can lead to improved development efficiency and maintainability.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: It improves the design, which can lead to improved development efficiency and maintainability.

agile-methodologies.question: Q54. Which choice is not a benefit generally associated with product demonstrations?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Learn about feature estimates.

agile-methodologies.question: Q55. What is an information radiator?
options: a list of KPIs for the team
a list of overdue action items
a highly visible display of key performance data
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: the task board

agile-methodologies.question: Q56. According to the Agile Manifesto, your highest priority is to \_.
options: get the job done on time
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: satisfy the customer

agile-methodologies.question: Q57. Product development organizations sometimes use descriptions of archetypal users and their values so that developers can design the system to meet their needs and wants. What are these descriptions called?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: personas

agile-methodologies.question: Q58. The Product Owner is focused on testing a new system concept in the marketplace as quickly and inexpensively as possible. What is this first-generation product called?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: minimum viable product

agile-methodologies.question: Q59. To whom should the Product Owner report?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: the Product Manager

agile-methodologies.question: Q60. What happens in Sprint 0?
options: The team delivers no story points in that sprint.
The team does regression testing before production release.
The team prepares to work on the product backlog.
This is the time to inspect and adapt.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: The team prepares to work on the product backlog.

agile-methodologies.question: Q61. What does the Definition of Done mean?
options: The story meets the INVEST criteria.
The team has completed all of the work in its Sprint.
The story has been handed off to the DevOps team.
The team has agreed on the criteria for story completion.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: The team has agreed on the criteria for story completion.

agile-methodologies.question: Q62. Which element is most important when describing your product?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: its benefits

agile-methodologies.question: Q63. Which choice best describes the Team Facilitator?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: an Agile coach

agile-methodologies.question: Q64. What is the name of the technique that divides a story into smaller pieces?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: story slicing

agile-methodologies.question: Q65. A team member comes to you with a complaint about another team member. What should you do?
options: Bring the complaint to the other person and try to resolve the issue.
Ask them to talk to the other person and try to work it out.
Notify HR of the problem and ask them to handle it.
Invite both people to a meeting and try to mediate the conflict.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Invite both people to a meeting and try to mediate the conflict.

agile-methodologies.question: Q66. What is the forming-storming-norming, performing model of team development known as?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: the Tuckman model

agile-methodologies.question: Q67. What is the name of the ceremony in which you inspect the work completed during the sprint?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Sprint Review

agile-methodologies.question: Q68. Which choice best describes an Agile Release Train (ART)?
options: comprised of the teams within a program
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: continuous delivery

agile-methodologies.question: Q69. As an Agile coach, what should be your attitude toward your team members' individual goals and motivations?
options: Understand them—try to align personal motivations with the team's progress toward the project goals.
Nurture them-goals are the reason why people want to be at work.
Disregard them — personal views have no bearing on reaching the project goals.
Leverage them — use personal goals to encourage team members to raise their performance levels.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Leverage them — use personal goals to encourage team members to raise their performance levels.

agile-methodologies.question: Q70. Which phrase best describes an Agile team?
options: A silo-skilled, self-directed team led by a project manager.
A cross-functional, long-lived group without deadlines.
A cross-functional, self-organized team with collective accountability.
A skilled, temporary team focused on a single project.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: A cross-functional, self-organized team with collective accountability.

agile-methodologies.question: Q71. Which technique does not help prioritize the backlog?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Kaizen

agile-methodologies.question: Q72. What does the Definition of Ready mean?
options: The story has been tested and is ready for production release.
The story is ready to be brought into a sprint.
The stakeholders are ready to discuss their requirements for the story.
The team has completed sprint 0 and is ready to work.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: The story is ready to be brought into a sprint.

agile-methodologies.question: Q73. Which is NOT a principle of the Scaled Agile Framework?
options: Unlock the intrinsic motivation of knowledge workers
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Centralize decision-making

agile-methodologies.question: Q74. What is the definition of capacity?
options: It is an inventory of the team's knowledge and skills that is used to plan the work that they do.
It is the number of teams that a Team Facilitator can support concurrently.
It means the team determines their availability for the next sprint.
It is the maximum number of stories that will be allowed in a sprint.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: It is the maximum number of stories that will be allowed in a sprint.

agile-methodologies.question: Q75. The team is complaining that they send requests for clarification to the Product Owner, but these requests go unanswered. What action should you take?
options: If there is a question about the story, tell the developers to use their best judgment, avoid delay, and discuss the issue in sprint review.
Send a note to the Product Owner saying the delays in completing the work will be their responsibility, not the team's.
Develop a service-level agree (SLA) that defines certain response times for different types of requests and ask the Product Owner to sign off on it.
Schedule a problem-solving session with the Product Owner and the other team members.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Schedule a problem-solving session with the Product Owner and the other team members.

agile-methodologies.question: Q76. Which choice is a pillar of Lean?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Respect for people and culture

agile-methodologies.question: Q77. Which statement best describes Agile, Lean, and Six Sigma?
options: They are strategies for delivering customer value.
They are strategies for discovering what the customer wants.
They are derived from statistical process control.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: They are strategies for delivering customer value.

agile-methodologies.question: Q78. What is a user story?
options: A description of what an actor wants to do to accomplish a goal
A description of archetypal users so the developers can make the solution user-friendly
A report from the field about a user's experience with the product
The Agile term for a requirement
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: The Agile term for a requirement

agile-methodologies.question: Q79. What is the expected output of a Planning Poker meeting?
options: The stories were discussed and each had a story point estimate assigned.
The team gave feedback to the Product Owner about the acceptance criteria.
The team decided what stories should be developed within the same sprint.
The team made a preliminary plan for which stories will be completed in the next quarter.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: The stories were discussed and each had a story point estimate assigned.

agile-methodologies.question: Q80. What is the definition of velocity?
options: The number of story points delivered during a sprint
The average waiting time for a story on the sprint backlog
The average wait time for a story to move from the product backlog to the sprint backlog
The time it takes a developer to complete a story divided by its relative value
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: The number of story points delivered during a sprint

agile-methodologies.question: Q81. What is most important for a successful Product Owner to understand?
options: The underlying technology of the product.
The development team's strengths and weaknesses.
The business context for the product.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: The business context for the product.

agile-methodologies.question: Q82. Which statement about the Agile Manifesto is true?
options: It was written via crowdsourcing and its authors are unknown.
It has been translated into dozens of languages and used around the world.
It was written in 2001 and is obsolete.
It was first published as part of Jim Highsmith's doctoral thesis.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: It has been translated into dozens of languages and used around the world.

agile-methodologies.question: Q83. The team is not going to complete its Sprint Commitment. As the Team Facilitator, what should you do?
options: Ask the PO to extend the sprint.
Advise the PO as soon as possible.
Report this at the Sprint Review.
Point out the reasons why and collaborate on solutions.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Point out the reasons why and collaborate on solutions.

agile-methodologies.question: Q84. When a user story is further decomposed, what are the elements called?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Who, What, Why

agile-methodologies.question: Q85. What does collective ownership mean?
options: Every member of the team can make changes to any part of the code as necessary.
If someone is at fault, then the whole team is at fault.
The team shares equally in the profits that the product generates.
The team, not the individuals, receives performance evaluations.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: The team shares equally in the profits that the product generates.

agile-methodologies.question: Q86. According to the Agile Manifesto, how often should developers and business people work together?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: daily

agile-methodologies.question: Q87. What do you call the practice of writing a test before the code is written?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: test-driven development

agile-methodologies.question: Q88. What is the term for a team member who is "T-skilled"?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: cross-functional

agile-methodologies.question: Q89. Which statement is not true about pair programming?
options: It has been discredited because it is too expensive.
In pair programming, two developers share one computer and take turns at the keyboard.
It is a great way to teach someone new to the team.
The code produced by two developers who are collaborating is typically higher quality than if they were working alone.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: It has been discredited because it is too expensive.

agile-methodologies.question: Q90. People with a fixed mindset \_ .
options: have better focus and longer attention spans
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: have better focus and longer attention spans

agile-methodologies.question: Q91. How can you improve interaction between team members?
options: Move people's workstations around in the team room to create new social possibilities.
Ask the team if they would like to do something recreational together and offer to organize it.
Tell the team that you see this as a problem and ask them to solve it.
Since no one has come to you with a complaint, assume that the limited interaction works for everyone.

a list of impediments and priorities
a report to the Product Owner of stories ready to be accepted

agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: It is a template for lightweight business plans that makes your assumptions explicit

agile-methodologies.question: Q96. The team is not going to complete its Sprint Commitment. As a Team Facilitator, what should you do?

agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: advise the PO as soon as possible

agile-methodologies.question: Q97. Which of these traits is most important for being an effective Team Facilitator?

agile-methodologies.question: Q98. When is the best time to update the team's burndown chart?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: before the daily Scrum

agile-methodologies.question: Q99. What is an Empathy Map?

It is a tool used by organizations for competitive intelligence.

It is a collaborative tool used to gain deeper insights into customers.
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: It is a collaborative tool used to gain deeper insights into customers.

agile-methodologies.question: Q100. Which work descriptions are not written in the language of users?
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: tasks

agile-methodologies.question: Q101. The team has an incomplete story at the end of the sprint and wants to claim partial credit for the work completed. What should you do?
options: Ask the Product Owner to accept the story with the promise that the team will complete it in the next sprint
Ask them to slice the story to reflect the work done and the work to be donef
Ask the product owner to revise the acceptance criteria so it can be accepted and counted
explain that, in Agile, working software is the primary measure of progress. Then help...
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Ask the product owner to revise the acceptance criteria so it can be accepted and counted

agile-methodologies.question: Q102. When planning a meeting, which action is most important?

agile-methodologies.question: Q103. You are facilitating a meeting and, unexpectedly, a key person doesn't attend. What should you do?

Ask all meeting participants what they want to do about the one person's absence
Reschedule the meeting for when all necessary people can attend
agile-methodologies.correctAnswer: Ask all meeting participants what they want to do about the one person's absence

a room for teams to demo their work
a placeholder in the code body for the future functionality
a meeting format where participants create and manage the agenda

Ask all meeting participants what they want to do about the one person's absence

team alignment on its plan for the day

agile-methodologies.question: Q140. As a Scrum Master, you have noticed a pattern that the most interesting stories on the sprint backlog get started right away, and the least interesting stories languish or don't get done. What should you do?
